text: Gim Myeong-ok (; born October 9, 1957), better known by the stage name Na-mi (), is a South Korean singer. She was considered a "superstar" and "icon" of Korean pop music in the 1980s and early 1990s. == Discography == === Studio albums === * I Loved You / I Like You (난 사랑했어요 / 좋아해) (1980) * International Waiting Room / Always (국제선 대합실 /언제까지나) (1981) * Na-mi '83 (1983) * Na-mi Vol. 4 (1984) * Overture (1987) * I Won't Say a Thing / Is This Hate or Longing? (아무말 않으리 / 미움인지 그리움인지) (1989) * Chameleon (1992) * A Long Winter (1996) Source: == Awards == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" !Year !Award !Category !Nominated work !Result !Ref. |- |1987 | rowspan="2" |Golden Disc Awards | rowspan="2" |Main Prize (Bonsang) |"Love is a Strange Thing" | | rowspan="2" | |- |1990 |"Like an Indian Doll" | |} ==References== Category:South Korean female pop singers Category:People from Dongducheon Category:South Korean Buddhists Category:Living people Category:1957 births
title: Na-mi
